description: From New Latin, corresponding to hecto- +‎ Ancient Greek κοτύλη (kotúlē, “small cup”).

entries.meaning: (zoology) A modified arm of any of several male cephalopods that functions as a reproductive organ by transfering sperm to the mantle of the female. [from 19th c.]
examples: The hectocotylus, like many other genitals, is made of soft tissues which are unlikely to be fossilised.
